page.title: 19EAST LEAKE FIRE STATION
page.content: The area is proud of the fact that it has its own brand new fire station.It was opened in 1984 and is situated near the centre of the village next to the library and Health Centre. It is a small station but still able to cope with most emergencies which take place. All the fireman are part-time,the Senior Officer running the local Post Office. The men are issued with 'bleepers' and when called have to hurry to the station as not all are required on separate calls.They are then employed on a 'first come first served'basis. If the emergency is of a particular serious nature then help is received from a larger station at West Bridgford some ten miles away.
